entry.title: What is ERC-1155? Ethereum’s Flexible Token Standard
entry.summary: ERC-1155 is a token standard that enables the efficient transfer of fungible and non-fungible tokens in a single transaction.

entry.title: Facebook Goes Full Metaverse With META Stock Ticker Change
entry.summary: Meta’s stock price has taken a beating recently, but the firm is doubling down.

entry.title: Crypto-Skeptic Tech Pros Counter-Lobby US Lawmakers
entry.summary: Leading technologists signed an anti-crypto letter to Washington, calling blockchain technology a “solution in search of a problem.”

entry.title: Elon Musk Fires Back at Dogecoin Co-Creator Over 'Grifter' Claims
entry.summary: Elon Musk had some harsh words for Dogecoin co-creator Jackson Palmer for his recent claims the billionaire doesn’t understand basic coding.

entry.title: South Korea to Launch 'Digital Assets Committee' in Response to Terra Implosion: Report
entry.summary: Following last month's Terra implosion, South Korean regulators are stepping up supervision measures for the fast-growing crypto industry.

entry.title: Dework Just Raised $5 Million. Could It Become Linkedin for DAOs?
entry.summary: The platform aims to help power the Web3 workforce.

entry.title: Bank of England to Rescue Collapsing Stablecoin Issuers—If They’re Big Enough
entry.summary: A new proposal would give England's central bank regulatory oversight over stablecoin issuers should they pose a risk to financial stability.

entry.title: Cannes Film Festival 2022: Crypto Comes to La Croisette
entry.summary: Web3, NFTs and crypto-powered filmmaking were much in evidence at this year's Cannes Film Festival. Decrypt reports from the scene.

entry.title: Optimism Token Plummets 65% Following Hyped Airdrop
entry.summary: Amid extreme network congestion following Optimism’s airdrop, the native token has plummeted by more than 60%.

entry.title: Zcash Nixes Trusted Setup, Enters New Era With Major Network Update
entry.summary: Network Upgrade 5, originally announced last June, introduces new features like automatic shielding and unified addresses.

entry.title: Ethereum Scaling Solution Optimism Airdrops Tokens to 249K Wallets
entry.summary: The hotly anticipated OP airdrop is live, although some users have been unable to claim tokens due to high demand.

entry.title: Was Alleged $2 Million Exploit of Mirror Protocol ‘100% Preventable’?
entry.summary: A substantial price discrepancy between LUNA and LUNC appears to have enabled the exploit, which was detected yesterday.

entry.title: Bitcoin Briefly Reclaims $32K for First Time in Three Weeks
entry.summary: BTC and ETH both rose by at least 5% on Tuesday as the entire crypto market rallied from a brutal few weeks.

entry.title: Why ‘Hunger Games’ Co-Producer Bryan Unkeless Is Making His Next Sci-Fi Project in Web3
entry.summary: Runner is a sci-fi multimedia project with plans for NFTs, a comic book, and a video game.

entry.title: Axie Infinity's AXS Token Rallies 19% Amid Builders Program Launch
entry.summary: Sky Mavis, the indie studio behind the Axie Infinity play-to-earn game, has announced the first 12 projects joining its Builders Program.

entry.title: What Is Runner? 'Hunger Games' Co-Producer's Web3 Sci-Fi Project
entry.summary: Decrypt's Kate Irwin speaks with Hollywood producer Bryan Unkeless and team members Bryce Anderson and Blaise Hemingway about their Web3 sci-fi project Runner, starting with an NFT project and a comic book all about racing.

entry.title: 'The Infinite Machine': Ethereum Origin Book Heads to the Screen
entry.summary: "The Infinite Machine" author Camila Russo sat down with Decrypt at Cannes to talk about the book’s upcoming movie adaptation, funded by NFTs.

entry.title: Ethereum’s Ropsten Test Network Ready for Merge ‘Dress Rehearsal’
entry.summary: Ethereum’s oldest proof-of-work testnet is transitioning to proof-of-stake, with two more to follow “before focus shifts to mainet.”

entry.title: Eurovision Winners Kalush Orchestra Raise Nearly $1M in Ethereum for Ukraine
entry.summary: Eurovision winners Kalush Orchestra auctioned off its trophy for 500 Ethereum to raise money for the Ukrainian army.

entry.title: Cardano Jumps 29% as Bitcoin, Ethereum Recover
entry.summary: Amid a recovering crypto market, the token underpinning the Cardano blockchain is up nearly 30% on the day.

entry.title: DeFi DIY: How to Stake Ethereum on Lido Finance
entry.summary: Curious about staking Ethereum? This week's DeFi D.I.Y. walks through how to deposit on Lido Finance as the network's merge event approaches.

entry.title: How Terra's Collapse Could Prompt an International Wave of Crypto Regulations
entry.summary: Short-term crackdowns could have long-term effects if more governments become less crypto-friendly.

entry.title: South Korean Authorities Launch Probe Into Terra Crash: Report
entry.summary: Terraform Labs Do Kwon allegedly ignored Terra’s design flaws to push for the launch of the UST stablecoin, according to a recent report.

entry.title: Prada Joining Top Luxury Brands in Web3 With Ethereum NFTs
entry.summary: It's releasing 100 NFTs to go along with its Cassius Hirst Timecapsule apparel drop.

entry.title: Tron Becomes DeFi’s Third-Largest Blockchain Thanks to Terra-Like Stablecoin
entry.summary: Tron’s DeFi activity saw a sharp spike following the launch of its algorithmic stablecoin promising more than 20% per year returns.

entry.title: Dogecoin Creator Jackson Palmer: 'I Wish It Was The End of Crypto, But It’s Not'
entry.summary: In an interview promoting his new podcast, Dogecoin creator Jackson Palmer launched another scathing broadside against the crypto industry.

entry.title: Bitcoin Reclaims $30,000 Level as Crypto Market Turns Green
entry.summary: Amid the broader market’s recovery, the price of Bitcoin soared late on Sunday to hit a weekly high above $30,700.

entry.title: Nike’s RTFKT Buys ‘DotSwoosh’ Ethereum Domain Name For $35K
entry.summary: Web3 brand RTFKT now owns 10 Ethereum Name Service domains.

entry.title: Balmain Seeks ‘Omnichannel’ Immersion for Fashionistas With Help of MINTNFT
entry.summary: The French ultra-luxury fashion house is creating the Non-Fungible Thread, an NFT-backed ecosystem.

entry.title: This Week on Crypto Twitter: ‘Pharma Bro’ Shkreli Calls Out Vitalik, LUNA 2.0 Nosedives After Launch
entry.summary: It was a relatively quiet week over on Crypto Twitter ... other than a convicted felon calling an Ethereum co-founder “full of shit.”

entry.title: Web3 IRL: How Digital Art at Physical Gatherings Is Building Community
entry.summary: At Coachella, drones were doing physical airdrops and there was an “Ether Egg Hunt.”

entry.title: Could Quantum Computers Defeat Bitcoin? Not So Fast.
entry.summary: Quantum computers could one day crack Bitcoin’s encryption, but it’s more likely cryptography will outwit new generations of supercomputers.

entry.title: LUNA Reboot Plummets Over 70% Just Hours After Debut
entry.summary: After peaking at $19.54 earlier on Saturday, it's been mostly downhill.

entry.title: The View (and Vibes) From the VeeCon NFT Conference
entry.summary: Despite the market downturn, Gary Vaynerchuk’s NFT event was a playful, entertaining celebration of the culture and creators.

entry.title: This Week in Coins: 'Ethereum Killers' Lose Big and More Unbanked Americans are Turning to Crypto
entry.summary: Bitcoin weathered a challenging week. Ethereum did not. And a new report out of Europe warns of the dangers of not regulating crypto.

entry.title: Is DeFi a Public Good?
entry.summary: In crypto, specifically DeFi, this distinction is a bit less clear.

entry.title: Ethereum's Merge is Coming and the Stakes Couldn't Be Higher
entry.summary: The most important upgrade in blockchain history is slated for August. And the outcome of the Ethereum merge has huge implications for all of crypto.

entry.title: Why Ava Labs Wants the Bored Ape Metaverse and ApeCoin on Avalanche
entry.summary: Is an Avalanche subnet the key to powering Yuga Labs’ Otherside and the ApeCoin ecosystem? Ava Labs makes its case.

entry.title: How Scorsese Producer Niels Juul's KinoDAO Is Using NFTs to Fund Indie Films
entry.summary: The producer of Martin Scorsese’s “The Irishman” and “Silence” is turning to Web3 to cut out the Hollywood gatekeepers.

entry.title: Elon Musk Says SpaceX Will Accept Dogecoin—And DOGE Predictably Pumps
entry.summary: Bear market and all, Elon Musk can still move prices with his tweets.

entry.title: ‘The Irishman’ Exec Producer Niels Juul Gets Into NFTs
entry.summary: Decrypt’s Kate Irwin talks to veteran Hollywood film producer Niels Juul about why he’s going all in on NFTs and Web3.

entry.title: Ethereum, Solana and Gaming Tokens Are Falling Fast as Crypto Slump Continues
entry.summary: The wider market remains down, but Ethereum and other altcoins are feeling even more pain while gaming and metaverse tokens struggle.

entry.title: Decrypt at Cannes: Decentralized Pictures CEO Leo Matchett Talks Hollywood Embracing Crypto
entry.summary: Decrypt's Stephen Graves heads to the 2022 Cannes Film Festival, where he sits down with Leo Matchett of Decentralized Pictures, the Roman Coppola-backed nonprofit using crypto and blockchain voting to find, fund, and produce films.

entry.title: Decrypt at Cannes: 'Calladita' Director Miguel Faus on Funding Films with NFTs
entry.summary: Decrypt's Stephen Graves is on the scene at the 2022 Cannes Film Festival, where he spoke to Miguel Faus, director of the film "Calladita," who funded his movie by selling NFTs to backers including NounsDAO.

entry.title: gm Podcast, Episode 10: DraftKings Goes Crypto
entry.summary: Crypto and sports continue to converge, and one of the best examples is DraftKings. CEO Jason Robins joins Dan Roberts and Jeff Roberts to talk about how DraftKings is embracing NFTs as prizes, when the company might accept crypto for entry fees and bets, and how his experience dealing with regulators and lawmakers mirrors what crypto companies are now going through in Washington.

entry.title: Decrypt Learn: What is Web3?
entry.summary: Web3 is the next evolution of the Internet, built on blockchains. Blockchains are a new kind of database, making new types of peer-to-peer apps possible. This has profound implications for humanity.

entry.title: How Brands Are Creating Immersive Experiences in the Metaverse
entry.summary: In Episode 10 of the Navigating the Metaverse podcast, hosted by Cathy Hackl and Tommaso di Bartolo, Andrew Hayward of Decrypt and Josh Roth of Decrypt Studios discuss how companies are approaching the metaverse, where it could all go next, and what it was like to watch a movie in a Lamborghini on the moon.

entry.title: #DecryptLIVE: Crypto crash roundtable
entry.summary: Crypto bloodbath! How low will the major coins go, and what about Terra and stablecoins? Decrypt’s Dan Roberts, Jeff Benson, Stacy Elliott and Jason Nelson will discuss the news and parse through what’s happened and what might happen next.

entry.title: Infura Co-Founder E.G. Galano Talks Otherside NFT Mint, Ethereum Gas Fees
entry.summary: Infura co-founder and general manager E.G. Galano talks to Decrypt's Kate Irwin about what Infura does, how the Bored Ape Yacht Club could have avoided the hiccups with its Otherdeed NFT mint, other hot NFT collections like Moonbirds, and Ethereum's gas fee issues.

entry.title: Decrypt Learn: What Is Ethereum 2.0? Ethereum's Consensus Layer and Merge Explained
entry.summary: The long-planned upgrade to Ethereum aims to improve the network’s scalability and security by switching to a proof of stake consensus mechanism.

entry.title: gm Podcast, Episode 9: Jesse Powell Releases the Kraken
entry.summary: Kraken was one of the earliest Bitcoin exchanges, and also made waves for its strong-willed reactions to regulatory changes. CEO Jesse Powell joined the gm podcast to talk to Dan Roberts and Jeff Roberts about Kraken's evolution, the killer use case for NFTs, and how San Francisco's tech scene has changed.
